name: places/ChIJkfJtVMVZwokRxiSGLI3dQwU
formattedAddress: 61 W 48th St, New York, NY 10020, USA
adrFormatAddress: 61 W 48th St, New York, NY 10020, USA

originalText.text:
This is a dream come true for a child interested in firefighters. (Just about any kid), it's a real life Firetruck ðŸš’ that has been parked in a Midtown storefront and that you can climb into, turn on the lights (sadly no sirens) and learn about the FDNY and how they help New York. There are a few plaques remembering the lost on 9/11 and plenty of volunteers who can share stories and information. It's near Times Square, no cost to enter (donations welcomed) and they have plenty of souvenirs , clothing and more for sale. Another plus in Midtown (free and clean bathrooms). I went with a four year old and he spent well over an hour exploring.
They also run workshops for schools and individuals about risks of home based fires and overall provide a great learning environment for visitors young and old.

originalText.text: We recently took a trip to NYC and decided to go to Fire Zone as our teen son aspires to be a FF. It was a nice interactive exhibit that we all found interesting! We were met by George, a retired NY FF, who gave us the royal treatment! We were glad we added this stop to our visit!

originalText.text:
Awesome place for everyone who loves and respect firefighters and what they do.
We recently visited NYC, and my 3 year old had a blast (not literally ðŸ˜‚) at the fire zone. He said it was the best part about NYC.
You can actually get to learn how to operate the rescue truck. It was fun trip for our family.

originalText.text: We came to NYC for sightseeing. I made all kinds of reservations for the popular tourist spots, but when we walked past here my son wanted to go in and we ended up spending an hour. Heâ€™s still talking about it days later, it was by far his favorite thing about the city. So learn from me: skip the Statue of Liberty and donate the money youâ€™d spend there to the FDNY ðŸ˜†

originalText.text: Super cool place, not just for kids like other reviews mention, but for adults and firefighter admirers too! Their patch collection is just incredible, and they have a lot of cool, good quality merchandise available that supports firefighters, we bought some enamel pins and patches. My sister who is an aspiring firefighter really loved it, we highly recommend it to anyone considering stopping by!
